temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.paths
Class APSP.NodeMapFromMatrix<T>

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.paths.APSP.NodeMapFromMatrix<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
AttrSink<T>, AttrSource<T>, NodeData, NodeMap<T>, NodeSink<T>, NodeSource<T>
Enclosing class:
APSP
private static class APSP.NodeMapFromMatrix<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeMap<T>

A node map which is just a row of a node matrix. In addition, while the matrix may store negative values, the node map only reports and sets positive values. A value for a node n in the nodemap representing distances from node s is m_sn + pot(n) - pot(s) where m_sn is the matrix entry for node pair (s,n).

Ensure the attribute set has capacity for storing attributes for cap nodes.

shrink

public void shrink(int cap,
                   int[] perm)
Description copied from interface: NodeData
Shrink the capacity to size cap, and compact the attributes according to a given permutation.

Specified by:
shrink in interface NodeData
Parameters:
cap - the new capacity.
perm - a permutation of the node ids, with the following properties:
  1. If there is a node with id i, then fillPerm[i] >= 0.
  2. If there is no node with id i then fillPerm[i] = -1.
  3. Monotonicity: fillPerm[j] > fillPerm[i] <=> j > i for every i and j such that there is a node with id i and a node with id j.
